conclusion: Determine maximum horizontal force F without causing block A to slide relative to block B.
Block A has mass 1kg, maximum static friction force between A and B is 1 N.
Block B has mass 2kg, coefficient of kinetic friction between B and ground is 0.1.
Gravitational force on B is 20 N, normal force is 20 N, kinetic friction force is 2 N.
Static friction force must prevent A from sliding, maximum is 1 N.
Maximum acceleration a is 1 m/sÂ² using static friction force.
Total mass of system is 3 kg, maximum force F without sliding is 3 N.
Force F must overcome kinetic friction, total F is 5 N.
Maximum horizontal force F that can be applied is 5 N.
